ancientTexts.title: Bhagavad Gita
ancientTexts.author: Ved Vyasa
ancientTexts.background: A 700-verse Hindu scripture that is part of the Mahabharata. It presents a conversation between Prince Arjuna and Lord Krishna on the battlefield of Kurukshetra.
ancientTexts.keyQuote: कर्मण्येवाधिकारस्ते मा फलेषु कदाचन | You have the right to perform your duty, but not to the fruits of action.
ancientTexts.relevanceToday: Teaches duty, detachment, and selfless service - principles vital for modern leadership, ethics, and mental resilience in a fast-paced world.

ancientTexts.title: Rig Veda
ancientTexts.author: Multiple Rishis
ancientTexts.background: The oldest of the four Vedas, containing 1,028 hymns dedicated to various deities. It explores creation, nature, and cosmic order.
ancientTexts.keyQuote: एकं सद्विप्रा बहुधा वदन्ति | Truth is one, the wise speak of it in many ways.
ancientTexts.relevanceToday: Emphasizes unity in diversity and the scientific spirit of inquiry - foundational to pluralism and innovation in modern education.

ancientTexts.title: Upanishads
ancientTexts.author: Various Sages
ancientTexts.background: A collection of philosophical texts forming the theoretical basis for Hinduism. They explore the nature of reality, self, and ultimate truth.
ancientTexts.keyQuote: तत्त्वमसि | Thou art that - You are the universal consciousness.
ancientTexts.relevanceToday: Encourages self-realization and inner exploration, relevant for mindfulness, psychology, and holistic well-being practices.

ancientTexts.title: Arthashastra
ancientTexts.author: Chanakya (Kautilya)
ancientTexts.background: An ancient treatise on politics, economics, military strategy, and governance. It provides practical wisdom on administration and diplomacy.
ancientTexts.keyQuote: The root of wealth is economic activity and lack of it brings material distress.
ancientTexts.relevanceToday: Offers timeless insights into economics, governance, and strategic thinking - applicable to business management and public policy today.

modernThinkers.title: Complete Works of Swami Vivekananda
modernThinkers.author: Swami Vivekananda
modernThinkers.background: A spiritual leader who introduced Vedanta and Yoga to the Western world. His speeches emphasized strength, self-confidence, and service to humanity.
modernThinkers.keyQuote: Arise, awake, and stop not till the goal is reached.
modernThinkers.relevanceToday: Inspires youth empowerment, interfaith harmony, and character building - essential for creating confident, compassionate leaders.

modernThinkers.title: Gitanjali
modernThinkers.author: Rabindranath Tagore
modernThinkers.background: Nobel Prize-winning poet, composer, and educator. His works blend spiritual depth with artistic beauty, celebrating humanity and nature.
modernThinkers.keyQuote: Where the mind is without fear and the head is held high.
modernThinkers.relevanceToday: Advocates for creative education, freedom of thought, and cultural synthesis - vital for progressive, inclusive learning environments.

modernThinkers.title: Wings of Fire
modernThinkers.author: A.P.J. Abdul Kalam
modernThinkers.background: India's Missile Man and 11th President. His autobiography chronicles his journey from humble beginnings to becoming a scientist and leader.
modernThinkers.keyQuote: Dream is not that which you see while sleeping, it is something that does not let you sleep.
modernThinkers.relevanceToday: Motivates scientific temperament, perseverance, and nation-building - crucial for inspiring STEM education and innovation.

scientificHeritage.title: Aryabhatiya
scientificHeritage.author: Aryabhata
scientificHeritage.background: A seminal work on mathematics and astronomy. Aryabhata calculated π accurately and explained planetary positions and eclipses.
scientificHeritage.keyQuote: The Earth rotates on its axis and revolves around the Sun.
scientificHeritage.relevanceToday: Demonstrates India's ancient contributions to mathematics and astronomy - inspiring scientific curiosity and pride in indigenous knowledge.

scientificHeritage.title: Sushruta Samhita
scientificHeritage.author: Sushruta
scientificHeritage.background: An ancient Sanskrit text on medicine and surgery. Sushruta is considered the father of surgery, detailing over 300 surgical procedures.
scientificHeritage.keyQuote: The surgeon must possess a steady hand, keen vision, and fearless heart.
scientificHeritage.relevanceToday: Highlights India's pioneering role in medical science - relevant for modern healthcare innovation and traditional medicine integration.

scientificHeritage.title: Charaka Samhita
scientificHeritage.author: Charaka
scientificHeritage.background: A foundational text of Ayurveda covering diagnosis, treatment, and prevention of diseases. It emphasizes holistic health and balance.
scientificHeritage.keyQuote: Health is the foundation of virtue, prosperity, enjoyment, and salvation.
scientificHeritage.relevanceToday: Promotes preventive healthcare and holistic wellness - increasingly relevant in modern integrative medicine and lifestyle management.

scientificHeritage.title: Lilavati
scientificHeritage.author: Bhaskara II
scientificHeritage.background: A mathematical treatise covering arithmetic, algebra, and geometry. Written in verse form, it makes complex concepts accessible and elegant.
scientificHeritage.keyQuote: Mathematics is the foundation of all sciences.
scientificHeritage.relevanceToday: Showcases creative pedagogy and mathematical excellence - inspiring innovative teaching methods in STEM education.

timeline.innovations: Composition of Vedas, development of Sanskrit, early mathematics, astronomy, and philosophical inquiry.
Philosophical texts exploring consciousness, metaphysics, and the nature of reality. Birth of yoga and meditation practices.
Chanakya's Arthashastra, spread of Buddhism, rock edicts, administrative systems, and economic theories.
Aryabhata's astronomy, decimal system, zero, advanced surgery by Sushruta, classical Sanskrit literature.
Bhaskara's mathematics, Ayurvedic texts, temple architecture, classical music and dance forms.
Swami Vivekananda's philosophy, Tagore's literature, freedom movement, modern education reforms.
Space exploration, IT revolution, pharmaceutical leadership, constitutional democracy, scientific research.
